Articles.Content:
Super Heavy Rocket Challenge

The SHRC is a Super Challenge that i do to go intersteller w/o docking. i have presented the challenge the player to make a safe Journey and to survive a reentry of about 2000 degrees to 5000 degrees with the help of some mods some required others Optional the mods are:

MODS

1. Shadowworks stockalike SLS and more mod* http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/128353-1-0-4-ShadowWorks-Stockalike-SLS-and-More-v1-2-1-9-26-2015

2. Space Y Heavy Lifters pack http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/100408

3. Space Y Expanded* http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/133301-1-0-4-WIP-SpaceY-Expanded-v0-6-1-(2015-10-02)

4. Mechjeb* http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/124336-PART-1-0-4-ON-HOLD-Anatid-Robotics-MuMech-MechJeb-Autopilot-v2-5-3-(July-6th)

5. Tweakscale* http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/112693-1-0-4-TweakScale-v2-2-1(Jun-26)-Drag-cube-scaling

6. AIES Aerospace* http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/35383-1-0-4-AIES-Aerospace-v1-6-1

*not required

RULES

1. must use required mods (Space Y heavy lifters pack)

2. must be manned

3. must return Safely

4. must be over 1000 tons

5. Post pics(or record) the Launch, kerbin field of influence exit, passing of Eeloo, kerbin field of influence entrance, reentry, and landed

6. Have fun

i will update this post with my pics

Update 1: made the challenge even harder with this beast (11000+ tons)

http://imgur.com/AEDulM7

Edited October 10, 2015 by pat8996

This is possible in stock, but using Space Y makes things much more EASIER because the bigger the rocket generally the more Delta V. You can actually do this with a modified Saturn V Rocket replica (replace the lander for more fuel) or even a Saturn Nova replica. ( both made in stock)

Still, I will have a go at this (My first manned interplanetary!!!).

Just made a rocket with 6540ms of dv for you but not sure if it's 1000t. Still is cool.

Just saying, a thousand tons of rocket can blow everything up. For people with bad computers, maybe a 200 - 500t rule?

- - - Updated - - -

And by the way, the 4 year wait is boring.

- - - Updated - - -

I mean 6 years since 2 for transfer:)

Edited October 10, 2015 by RA3236

It turns out that I almost burned up on reentry:). So I used infinite rcs and better time warp to return me back to Kerbin. And I'll double check that mass, it might be over 500t but not over a thousand

- - - Updated - - -

I really need to stop posting now...

- - - Updated - - -

Found it: 508t
